verses.roman:
tayor āsanam ānīya
pādyaṁ cārghyārhaṇādibhiḥ
pūjāṁ sānugayoś cakre
srak-tāmbūlānulepanaiḥ

synonyms: tayoḥ—for Them; āsanam—seats; ānīya—bringing; pādyam—water to wash the feet; ca—and; arghya—with water to wash the hands; arhaṇa—presents; ādibhiḥ—and so on; pūjām—worship; sa-anugayoḥ—of the two, together with Their companions; cakre—he performed; srak—with garlands; tāmbūla—betel-nut preparation (pān); anulepanaiḥ—and sandalwood paste.
translation: After offering Them seats and bathing Their feet, Sudāmā worshiped Them and Their companions with arghya, garlands, pān, sandalwood paste and other presentations.
